etymologies: mid 19th century. From German Rubiacin from rubiac- (in classical Latin Rubiaceae, family name) + German -in

definitions: A yellow crystalline colouring matter obtained from madder root.

notes.text: Investigation of Schunck's samples in the 1970s showed that rubiacin is an anthraquinone derivative, 1,3-dihydroxyanthraquinone-2-al, C₁₅H₈O₅.
